p: Climate change may cause more frequent and intense hurricanes, which can reduce long-term C storage in forests [ 42]. Results for SC suggest that if another Hurricane Hugo were to hit the coastal U.S., increasing salvage rates above those implemented after the 1989 hurricane would cause a substantial reduction in CO 2e emissions because the salvaged wood displaces emissions from non-woody building materials and fossil fuels, rather than decomposing in the forest.
